metadata.titel_preek: Trinity Sunday and Psalm 130: The Depth of Sin and the Radiance of Grace

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, whose inner nature is self-giving love, pursues and redeems humanity from a state of primordial catastrophe and self-destruction.

subject.identificatie: The Triune God (Father, Son, and Holy Spirit)
tekstueel_bewijs: God pursues us even beyond the grave
The love that persists in breaking through our resistance
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities

object.identificatie: Redemption and the restoration of the 'miserable offender'

zender.identificatie: The Triune God (as the source of self-giving love)
tekstueel_bewijs: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness that pours itself out
the church that was breaking his heart is the one that gets the full Trinitarian blessing

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (Incarnation/Blood) and the Holy Spirit; human love as a 'glimmer'
tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son
That person has conveyed to you a measure of the love of God

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin as a 'vast primordial catastrophe', self-destruction, and human resistance
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not as a minor mistake but as a 'primordial catastrophe' and 'ontological depth' that no human can overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of confession and 'fear of the Lord' as an entrance into the larger life God has provided.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The Psalmist
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human action (confession) is a response to the realization of God's prior character (forgiveness).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God pursues us even beyond the grave
The love that persists in breaking through our resistance
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We have followed too much the devices
The psalmist ceases to reflect upon himself

voorbeelden: things which we ought to have done
you would do anything, anything at all
recognize that sin is not breaking rules
understand what is meant here by the fear of the Lord
total inability to present ourselves righteous
God who can redeem humanity from so grave a predicament

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes human 'non-pouvoir' (inability) met by God's 'pouvoir' (sovereign power to redeem).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Depths) to ~S2 (Honesty about sin) to S1 (Grace). It explicitly critiques ~S1 (Legalism).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'fear of the Lord' which is a response to the majesty of S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is described as a 'vast primordial catastrophe'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies God as the primary actor who initiates love toward the unworthy. It avoids moralism by emphasizing human inability.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in the parent analogy
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Imagine for a moment that you are the parent...

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as active Subject of verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The God who pursues us even beyond the grave
It is not dependent on the worthiness of the other

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: While human parents are mentioned, they are used as 'glimmers' or 'hints' of God's character, not as models for the hearer to emulate to earn salvation.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: N/A - The sermon already treats them theocentrically.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief, awe, and 'fear' (reverence) rather than the burden of performance.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace: salvation is entirely God's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The primary program (God saves) and secondary program (human confession) are perfectly ordered; confession is the 'entrance' into the life God has already provided.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'fellowship' and the power that 'persists in breaking through'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God's character. The hearer is positioned as the 'miserable offender' who is the object of divine pursuit.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic grace structure.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already avoids 'cheap grace' by taking sin seriously.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace.' It maintains God as the Subject of all transformative verbs while unflinchingly diagnosing the human condition.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis might focus on the parent-child pathos; Greimas reveals that the parent is merely a 'Helper' actant pointing to the 'Sender' (God).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek/Hebrew; Greimas shows how the sermon's 'engine' functions to either burden or liberate the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'fear of the Lord' is a modal competence (Savoir/Vouloir) that only emerges after the Subject (God) has performed the act of forgiveness.

appendices.notities: The sermon explicitly fights against the 'removal' of sin-language in modern liturgy, seeing it as a semiotic necessity for the 'merit of bounty' to be visible.
